item.description: ... To do: Check for missing use strict and use warnings, or their equivalent (e.g. use NAP::policy - Perl critic does this); To do: Prevent merging more than one commit to master (best practice says they should be squashed into a single commit) ...
item.dc:creator: Will Sheppard

item.title: Commands: Git workflow
item.description: Best practice. branch from master; make changes; when you're ready to merge back, first rebase onto master; then merge to master in your working directory; squash all your commits into a single commit; push the single commit to master.
item.dc:creator: Will Sheppard

item.description: Hi, and welcome to “Design Patterns in Ruby.” In this course, we'll review twelve common patterns for better development. Each episode will provide an overview of a problem, and then propose a solution, using a particular design pattern.
